question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.body:
(1) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. (3) The question about OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined question resolves as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if at least 10 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party publicly endorse President Biden's nomination before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If fewer than 10 such endorsements occur by that time, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that at least 10 House/Senate Democrats publicly endorse Biden's nomination before July 21, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. This is in the context of ongoing dissent among Democrats regarding the nomination process. The letter is being organized by House Democrats, indicating significant opposition to the plan. If these criteria are not met by the specified time, the question resolves as No.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given fewer than 10 House/Senate Democrats publicly endorse Biden's nomination before July 21, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if fewer than 10 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party publicly endorse President Biden's nomination before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If at least 10 such endorsements occur by that time, this question resolves as No.

question.body:
(1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(3) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given both Democratic pressure on Biden to drop out and Biden's presidency by July end, will Trump gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden is still president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Q.title: Will Will Hurd receive more than 15% of the delegate votes at the Republican National Convention?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Will Hurd receives more than 15% of the votes from delegates at the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It will resolve as No if he receives 15% or less.

P_given_Q.title: Given Will Hurd receives more than 15% of the delegate votes, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_given_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd receives more than 15% of the votes from delegates at the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question will resolve as Yes if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It will resolve as No if he is not selected. The outcome is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Will Hurd receives 15% or less of the delegate votes at the Republican National Convention, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Will Hurd receives 15% or less of the votes from delegates at the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It will resolve as No if he receives more than 15%. Furthermore, this question will resolve as Yes if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

Resolution criteria: The condition is that Will Hurd must receive 15% or less of the delegate votes. The outcome resolves as Yes if he is selected as the nominee and No otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is not based on who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election, but solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

2. The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

Q.body: This question resolves as Yes if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for June 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to May 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

question.title: Given both (a) Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday and (b) Joe Biden's dropout is covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:

(a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.body:

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given both a Democratic debate and Greens-EFA win, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Q.title: Will any other candidate be blocked from the primary election ballot in a U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as 'Yes' if, on July 15, 2024, any other candidate besides Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.

The removal or block for both must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as 'No' if these conditions are not met for Donald Trump as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

Note that this does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

question.title: Given Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden and is charged with witness tampering in Georgia, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. This resolves YES if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

Q.title: Will Donald Trump be convicted of any crimes related to the Georgia charges before July 27, 2024?
Q.body: This resolves YES if there is an official conviction of Donald Trump for any crimes related to witness tampering or any other charges arising from *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before July 27, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Donald Trump is convicted of any crimes related to the Georgia charges before July 27, 2024, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
P_given_Q.body:

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents and Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This part of the question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Q.title: Will Donald Trump receive a significant endorsement from a prominent Republican figure before July 26, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if a prominent Republican figure publicly endorses Donald Trump before the market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that Donald Trump receives a significant endorsement from a prominent Republican figure before July 26, 2024, will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat, and is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024; (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
P_given_Q.body:
This question combines two conditions:

(1) The first part resolves YES if, in two Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden exceeds that against a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al, occurring before June 1, 2024.

(2) The second part resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

If either part does not meet its criteria, the overall question resolves as NO.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Donald Trump will not receive a significant endorsement from a prominent Republican figure before July 26, 2024, will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents against Joe Biden and is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and (2) Joe Biden dies before July 26, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question combines two conditions: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump must gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents in two polls that close on July 6, 2024, and he must be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. The percentage of votes for Trump in poll 1 must exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. This part resolves YES if the formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03, otherwise NO. Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024. (2) Joe Biden's death must be officially announced before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024, resolving YES if such an announcement occurs, otherwise NO.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

Q.title: Will at least 40% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.4. The 'no opinion' respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve as No.

P_given_Q.title: Given that at least 40% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The 'no opinion' respondents will be ignored. The previous polls indicate a steady increase in the belief of achieving weak AGI, with prior results showing 15% and 27%. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th. If the condition of at least 40% agreement is met, then we assess the likelihood of at least 30% agreement based on the ongoing polling trend.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that less than 40% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) less than 0.4 for the first question. The 'no opinion' respondents will be ignored. For the second question, it will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The 'no opinion' respondents will be ignored. The outcome of this conditional question will depend on the results of both polls.

question.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Q.title: Will the overall voter turnout in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections exceed 50%?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the official voter turnout percentage reported by the European Parliament exceeds 50% after the elections.

P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves as Yes if the official voter turnout percentage reported by the European Parliament exceeds 50% after the elections. Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the overall voter turnout in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections does not exceed 50%, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the elections if at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: The overall voter turnout in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections does not exceed 50%. This question will resolve as Yes if the official voter turnout percentage reported by the European Parliament does not exceed 50% after the elections.

Additionally, at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on both (a) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

(a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024: Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding. Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th. This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: This question will resolve as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

If the condition is not met, resolve N/A.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Q.title: Will any other prominent Democratic candidate announce their candidacy before July 22, 2024?
Q.body: This question resolves YES if any major candidate from the Democratic Party officially announces their candidacy for the presidential election before July 22, 2024.

P_given_Q.title: Given that any prominent Democratic candidate announces their candidacy before July 22, 2024, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout story at least 6 hours in advance?
P_given_Q.body:
This question resolves YES if any major candidate from the Democratic Party officially announces their candidacy for the presidential election before July 22, 2024. Additionally, it resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given no other prominent Democratic candidate announces their candidacy before July 22, 2024, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout story at least 6 hours in advance?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question resolves YES if no major candidate from the Democratic Party officially announces their candidacy for the presidential election before July 22, 2024. question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% against Biden among Manifold respondents and Sunak fails in 2024, will Trump be blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.body:

If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

3. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If all three conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.body:

Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, given the above, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

Q.title: Will Ukraine successfully reclaim control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Ukrainian control. It will resolve as No if the area is still assessed to be under Russian control according to the ISW map.

P_given_Q.title: Given Ukraine successfully reclaims control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024, will Russia still have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_given_Q.body:
This question considers the scenario where Ukraine has successfully reclaimed control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024. It will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control, such as:
- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

It will resolve as No if the area is assessed to be under Ukrainian control according to the ISW map, meaning it shows the coordinates under any of the categories indicating Ukrainian control, such as:
- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that Ukraine does not successfully reclaim control of Chasiv Yar before June 1, 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question considers the situation on June 1, 2024, and resolves as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

It resolves as No if the area is assessed to be under any of the categories indicating Ukrainian control according to the ISW map, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This is determined by the ISW map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact value.

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

It resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given both Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Q.title: Will there be an increase in security measures in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if heightened security measures are implemented and publicly announced by the French government in response to the threat of terrorism during the period of the 2024 Summer Olympics, from the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 to the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024. The question will resolve as No if such measures are not significantly increased or announced.

P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if heightened security measures are implemented and publicly announced by the French government in response to the threat of terrorism during the period of the 2024 Summer Olympics, from the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 to the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024, and if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if such measures are not significantly increased or announced, or if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

P_given_not_Q.body:

The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. 

The condition is that heightened security measures must not be implemented and publicly announced by the French government in response to the threat of terrorism during the period of the 2024 Summer Olympics.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus having a brokered convention? The question resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is required, and **No** if only one ballot is needed.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:

This will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is the following true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If this occurs, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: If both the Crimean Bridge is attacked and Biden drops out before July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

If any of the first two conditions are not met, the resolution is N/A. If the first two conditions are met, but Asa Hutchinson is not selected as the nominee, the resolution is **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

This resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories indicating Russian control. question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (c) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The European Union announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump be blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (3) Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

3. Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This condition will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines?

If there are no such reports before that date, then the outcome resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

For the condition to be true, Tucker Carlson must be the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the outcome to be true, the formal declaration under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment must occur before August 2024, regardless of the duration of the incapacity. Biden exiting the office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.
